headline: Choosing the right fuel is like choosing the right tool for the job
summary: In this episode of Net-Zero Carbon, host Mary O’Connell sits down with Dave Slade, principal biofuels scientist at Chevron, to break down the various fuels available to fleets, the advantages of running alternative fuel options, and how companies can decide what fuels are best for them. The post Choosing the right fuel is like choosing the right tool for the job appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: TotalEnergies to sell 40% stake in Nigerian offshore licences to Chevron company
summary: TotalEnergies will have a 40% participation stake and continue as operator, while Chevron will hold another 40% stake in the licences.

headline: Chevron upgraded as HSBC says recent share weakness overdone
summary: Investing.com -- HSBC upgraded Chevron to Buy, saying the stock’s recent underperformance has created an entry point. Chevron’s target price was raised to $169 from $166 at HSBC. The shares have lagged both integrated oils and the S&P 500 in recent months, with a sharper drop in the past week. It linked part of the weakness to media reports about Chevron’s interest in Lukoil assets, including stakes in Kazakhstan and Iraq, and said the reaction was excessive.

headline: TotalEnergies Sells 40% Stake in Nigerian Offshore Project to Chevron
summary: TotalEnergies sold a 40% stake in two offshore Nigerian exploration licenses to Chevron, strengthening their global joint venture as oil majors increase their commitment to boosting output in the West African country.

headline: TotalEnergies Expands Chevron Partnership With Nigeria Offshore Deal
summary: TotalEnergies deepens its global exploration alliance with Chevron through a major offshore Nigeria farmout.

headline: TotalEnergies to Sell Stake in Nigeria Projects to Chevron
summary: Chevron subsidiary Star Deep Water Petroleum will take a 40% stake in the PPL 2000 and 2001 licences located in the West Delta basin.

raw.headline: TotalEnergies to Sell Stake in Nigeria Projects to Chevron
raw.summary: Chevron subsidiary Star Deep Water Petroleum will take a 40% stake in the PPL 2000 and 2001 licences located in the West Delta basin.

headline: Exploration: TotalEnergies Strengthens its Global Collaboration with Chevron
summary: PARIS, December 01, 2025-- Further to an ongoing discussion of global exploration opportunities between TotalEnergies (Paris:TTE) (LSE:TTE) (NYSE:TTE) and Chevron, TotalEnergies EP Nigeria has signed a farmout agreement to sell to Star Deep Water Petroleum Limited, a Chevron company, a 40% participation in the PPL 2000 and PPL 2001 exploration licenses, offshore Nigeria.

headline: Gunvor Eyes Investment in U.S. Oil and Gas
summary: Gunvor is exploring U.S. oil and gas asset purchases—primarily in natural gas—to strengthen ties with the Trump administration and expand its American presence.
